New Records: James Rodríguez scored the 13th goal in South American World Cup qualifying
Yerson Mosquera's header equaled Carlos Valderrama's record of 11 assists in South American World Cup qualifying
Key Match Events: Yerson Mosquera opened the scoring for Colombia in the 25th minute
Diego Gómez scored the winner for Paraguay in the 20th minute
Nico Gonzalez equalized for Argentina in the 48th minute
Rodríguez scored the winning penalty for Colombia in the 60th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina and Brazil struggled without their injured stars, Messi and Neymar respectively
Post-Match Reflections: Rodríguez praised his team's performance and the fair win against Argentina
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia had not beaten Argentina since 2019
Paraguay collected a historic win that keeps the team in contention for a spot in the next World Cup
Others: Argentina leads the round-robin competition with 18 points after eight matches, two points clear of Colombia
Uruguay is in third position with 15 points, followed by Ecuador with 14
All teams have two more qualifying matches next month
The top six teams in South American qualifying will get automatic spots at the 2026 World Cup
